intro: Borreria latituba, commonly known as the creeping borreria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that root at the nodes. Its small, white to pinkish flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the summer months. Borreria latituba is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
